title: How to check if two images are same are not.
text:
How to check if two images are same are not.

import numpy as np
import cv2


img2 = cv2.imread('MEDFUSE.jpg',0)
img1 = cv2.imread('Test_Image.jpg',0)
 

def mse(img1, img2):
   h, w  = img1.shape
   diff = cv2.subtract(img1, img2)
   err = np.sum(diff**2)
   mse = err/(float(h*w))
   return mse, diff


error, diff = mse(img1, img2)
print("Image matching Error between the two images:",error)
# cv2.imwrite('difference_image_2.jpg', diff)

Image matching Error between the two images: 71.15006839206238

title: How to check if two images are same are not.
text:
How to check if two images are same are not.

import numpy as np
import cv2


img2 = cv2.imread('MEDFUSE.jpg',0)
img1 = cv2.imread('Test_Image.jpg',0)
 

def mse(img1, img2):
   h, w  = img1.shape
   diff = cv2.subtract(img1, img2)
   err = np.sum(diff**2)
   mse = err/(float(h*w))
   return mse, diff


error, diff = mse(img1, img2)
print("Image matching Error between the two images:",error)
